episode.title: AeroVista Overview: 7 Divisions + How They Interlock

content.summary_short: A high-signal overview of AeroVista’s 7 divisions, what each ships, and how projects flow across the ecosystem.
content.summary_long: Episode 2 makes the AeroVista operating model obvious: each division has clear outputs, and projects move through predictable handoffs. You’ll learn what each division ships (bread & butter), how a Seed becomes a Drop, and where contributors can plug in immediately. Ends with a simple lane-pick quest + an alignment quiz.

slides.title: The Point
slides.goal: Why divisions exist and how to think about them.
bullets: AeroVista is one ecosystem with multiple ship-lanes.
Divisions protect focus and raise quality.
Everything ends as a deliverable someone can use.

slides.title: 7 Divisions — One Breath Each
bullets: NeXuS TechWorks: build the systems and glue.
SkyForge: interactive experiences and quests.
EchoVerse: music, sound design, audio tooling.
Summit: teaching packs and training systems.
Lumina: branding, visuals, launch kits.
Vespera: docs, books/courses, packaged knowledge.
Horizon: drone/capture, mapping, visual products.

slides.title: Bread & Butter Outputs
bullets: NeXuS ships apps, APIs, automation, infra hardening.
SkyForge ships playable pages, minigames, engagement modules.
EchoVerse ships tracks, stems, cover prompts, visualizers.
Summit ships curricula, SOPs, onboarding flows.
Lumina ships brand kits, templates, launch assets.
Vespera ships structured docs/products people can buy or reuse.
Horizon ships capture packages (video, maps, 3D, reports).

slides.title: How They Interlock
bullets: NeXuS provides the platform + deployment lane.
SkyForge turns ideas into interactive experiences.
EchoVerse gives it a soundtrack + vibe memory.
Lumina makes it look like a real product.
Summit documents + teaches it once for reuse.
Vespera packages the knowledge for distribution.
Horizon adds real-world capture when needed.

slides.title: Example Flow: Seed → Drop
bullets: Seed: single-file demo + clear intent + fast ship.
Signal: feedback (people finish it, share it, remember it).
Scale: graduate into a Drop (multi-file bundle, docs, polish).
Repeat: winners become products; everything else becomes lessons.

slides.title: Recruitment: Where You Plug In
bullets: Pick a lane: build / design / audio / docs / interactive.
Ship one improvement: problem → impact → fix.
Earn trust through proof-of-work, not permission.

slides.title: What’s Next
bullets: Next: division ByteCasts — deeper workflows + starter tasks.
Each division gets quests + badges + repeatable templates.
You won’t be confused — you’ll have a lane.

items.text: Pick a division lane you want to contribute to.
Choose 1 starter output you can ship in 30–90 minutes.
Write it clean: problem → impact → fix (or build → test → deliver).

questions.q: The core purpose of divisions is to:
choices: Protect focus and ship clearer outputs
questions.explain: Divisions protect focus while still supporting clean handoffs.

questions.q: A Seed is best described as:
choices: A fast, portable demo with clear intent
questions.explain: Seeds ship quickly and stay portable (often single-file).

questions.q: Which division is most responsible for playable web experiences?
questions.explain: SkyForge builds interactive experiences, quests, and mini-games.

questions.q: The best recruitment signal inside AeroVista is:
questions.explain: Small shipped wins get noticed and trusted.
We ship, measure signal, and scale winners.

aerovista_about.summary: AeroVista is a multi-division creative + engineering ecosystem shipping reusable experiences that blend software, storytelling, automation, music, and design.

divisions.name: NeXuS TechWorks
divisions.bread_and_butter: Full-stack engineering, offline-first apps, automation pipelines, DevOps, security hardening.

divisions.name: SkyForge Creative Studios
divisions.bread_and_butter: Interactive builds: playable sites, quests, AR/VR concepts, narrative experiences.

divisions.name: EchoVerse Audio
divisions.bread_and_butter: Music production, sound design, album worlds, audio tooling, interactive player drops.

divisions.name: Summit Learning
divisions.bread_and_butter: Teaching systems, tutorials, internal training, playbooks, skill paths.

divisions.name: Lumina Creative
divisions.bread_and_butter: Branding, visuals, marketing assets, launch kits, content strategy.

divisions.name: Vespera Publishing
divisions.bread_and_butter: Digital content, books/courses, structured knowledge products.

divisions.name: Horizon Aerial & Visual
divisions.bread_and_butter: Drone cinematography, mapping, 3D capture, real estate/ag/visual products.
